1{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
2
3-- | Encode and decode integers.
4
5module Koshucode.Baala.Overture.Text.Integer
6  ( -- * Decoder
7    stringDec, stringInt, stringInteger,
8    stringHex, stringHexInt, stringHexInteger,
9    -- * Encoder
10    intLowerHexString, intUpperHexString,
11    integralCustomString, integralReckonString,
12  ) where
13
14import qualified Data.Char                      as Ch
15import qualified Data.IntMap.Strict             as Map
16import qualified Numeric                        as Num
17
18
19-- ----------------------  Decoder
20
21stringMaybe :: (String -> [(a, String)]) -> String -> Maybe a
22stringMaybe f s = case f s of
23                  [(x, "")] -> Just x
24                  _         -> Nothing
25
26-- | Decode decimal integer.
27stringDec :: (Eq n, Num n) => String -> Maybe n
28stringDec = stringMaybe Num.readDec
29
30-- | Decode decimal integer as 'Int'.
31--
32--   >>> stringInt "12"
33--   Just 12
34--
35--   >>> stringInt "12.3"
36--   Nothing
37--
38--   >>> stringInt "12345678901234567890"
39--   Just (-6101065172474983726)
40--
41stringInt :: String -> Maybe Int
42stringInt = stringDec
43
44-- | Decode decimal integer as 'Integer'.
45--
46--   >>> stringInteger "12345678901234567890"
47--   Just 12345678901234567890
48--
49stringInteger :: String -> Maybe Integer
50stringInteger = stringDec
51
52-- | Decode hexadecimal digits.
53stringHex :: (Eq n, Num n) => String -> Maybe n
54stringHex = stringMaybe Num.readHex
55
56-- | Decode hexadecimal digits as 'Int'.
57--
58--   >>> stringHexInt "0F"
59--   Just 15
60--
61stringHexInt :: String -> Maybe Int
62stringHexInt = stringHex
63
64-- | Decode hexadecimal digits as 'Integer'.
65--
66--   >>> stringHexInteger "0F"
67--   Just 15
68--
69stringHexInteger :: String -> Maybe Integer
70stringHexInteger = stringHex
71
72
73-- ----------------------  Encoder
74
75integralLowerHexString :: (Integral n, Show n) => n -> String
76integralLowerHexString n = Num.showHex n ""
77
78integralUpperHexString :: (Integral n, Show n) => n -> String
79integralUpperHexString = map Ch.toUpper . integralLowerHexString
80
81-- | Encode integer to hexadecimal string.
82--
83--   >>> intHexString 15
84--   "f"
85--
86intLowerHexString :: Int -> String
87intLowerHexString = integralLowerHexString
88
89-- | Encode integer to hexadecimal string.
90--
91--   >>> intUpperHexString 15
92--   "F"
93--
94intUpperHexString :: Int -> String
95intUpperHexString = integralUpperHexString
96
97-- | Encode integer to custome-digit string.
98--
99--   >>> integralCustomString "OI" <$> [0..8 :: Int]
100--   ["O", "I", "IO", "II", "IOO", "IOI", "IIO", "III", "IOOO"]
101--
102integralCustomString :: (Integral n) => String -> n -> String
103integralCustomString digits = loop "" . abs where
104    dig  = Map.fromList $ zip [0..] digits
105    base = integralLength digits
106    loop s 0 | null s    = [dig Map.! 0]
107             | otherwise = s
108    loop s n = case quotRem n base of
109                 (n', i) -> loop (dig ! i : s) n'
110
111-- | Encode integer to reckoning string.
112--
113--   >>> intReckonString ['A'..'Z'] <$> [0, 1, 2, 25, 26, 27, 52, 53, 100, 1000, 5303449]
114--   ["", "A", "B", "Y", "Z", "AA", "AZ", "BA", "CV", "ALL", "KOSHU"]
115--
116integralReckonString :: (Integral n) => String -> n -> String
117integralReckonString digits = loop "" . abs where
118    dig       = Map.fromList $ zip [0..] $ '_' : digits
119    base      = integralLength digits
120    loop s 0  = s
121    loop s n  = case reckonDiv n base of
122                  (n', m) -> loop (dig ! m : s) n'
123
124-- | Integral version
125(!) :: (Integral n) => Map.IntMap a -> n -> a
126(!) m n = m Map.! fromIntegral n
127
128-- | Integral version of 'length'.
129--
130--   >>> integralLength "abc" :: Integer
131--   3
132--
133integralLength :: (Integral n) => [a] -> n
134integralLength [] = 0
135integralLength (_ : xs) = 1 + integralLength xs
136
137-- | Reckoning division.
138--
139--  >>> (`reckonDiv` 3) <$> [1 .. 10 :: Int]
140--  [(0,1),(0,2),(0,3),(1,1),(1,2),(1,3),(2,1),(2,2),(2,3),(3,1)]
141--
142reckonDiv :: (Integral n) => n -> n -> (n, n)
143reckonDiv x y =
144    case quotRem x y of
145      (q, r) | r == 0    -> (q - 1, y)
146             | otherwise -> (q, r)
